WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Alexandra Hardin
Address: Skowronka Road
Birthplace: Scotland

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada? 1904
Where did you set up housekeeping? 8 miles S.E. of the present Town of Scott Creek (called Scott Creek until 1935)
Where had you been living before that? Montana
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6
How far was it to your nearest store? 4.5 miles (Scott Creek)
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a month for supplies
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, coffee, tea, beans, dried fruit, bacon, canned vegetables, molasses, tomatoes, pumpkin, canned corn, peas. Did you also not have fresh vegetables so far as hard to haul? Would be shipped when available at some time.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Five Roses
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 to 150 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour?
How much did you use graham flour? Very little
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? What year?
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? No
Farina?
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? We bought it again new

Received Sept. 4/57

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Beef.

How did you get fresh meat? Killed our own pigs.

How often did you get fresh meat? Whenever we needed it.

How did you preserve meat? Always had fresh meat.

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? No.

If so what year was it organized?

Did you use game? Sometimes yes. What kinds? Deer.

For how long?

What part did fish play in the family diet? Very little.

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh from creek.

Kinds? Gold eyes & suckers.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

We always had beef stewed beef meal, hash, coffee or pancakes, also potatoes for breakfast whatever you wished also bacon sometimes & coffee also jams Marmalade or syrup.

For dinner roast beef or stew Macaroni, canned tomatoes or corn or peas Potatoes gravy pie or pudding.

For supper maybe cold meat. Potatoes & any left over.
